parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To make rich, cause to abound in, enrich. From ploutos; to make wealthy.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Simplicity, sincerity, purity, graciousness. From haplous; singleness, i.e. sincerity, or generosity.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Feminine Singular

str2: A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From kata and ergazomai; to work fully, i.e. Accomplish; by implication, to finish, fashion.
Thankfulness, gratitude; giving of thanks, thanksgiving. From eucharistos; gratitude; actively, grateful language.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
